channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Why a hand gesture has South Korean companies on edge
Explosion rips through Kabul crowd leaving a number of civilians dead, Taliban say
item.description: An explosion ripped through a crowd outside the entrance of a mosque in central Kabul on Sunday, leaving a number of civilians dead, a Taliban spokesman said.

item.title: Up to 3,200 pedophiles worked in French Catholic Church since 1950, independent commission says
item.description: Between 2,900 and 3,200 pedophile clergymen have worked in the French Catholic Church since the 1950s, the president of an independent commission on sexual abuse told CNN Sunday.

item.title: Taiwan says China sends 77 warplanes into its defense zone in two days
item.description: Taiwan has reported a record number of incursions by Chinese warplanes into its air defense identification zone (ADIZ) for the second day in a row, Taiwan's Ministry of National Defense said on Saturday night.

item.title: Police failures exposed by Sarah Everard murder underpin dark culture
item.description: When thousands gathered to mourn the death of Sarah Everard, a 33-year-old woman who was kidnapped, raped and murdered in March, London police responded with force.

item.title: 'Every one of those deaths is unnecessary,' expert says of rising Covid-19 US death toll
item.description: With a first-of-its-kind antiviral pill against Covid-19 potentially headed towards distribution, the health care community may soon have another tool to combat a virus that has claimed the lives of more than 700,000 Americans.

item.title: Thousands protest across Brazil calling for President Bolsonaro's impeachment
item.description: Protesters returned to the streets in major cities across Brazil on Saturday, calling for the impeachment of President Jair Bolsonaro amid worsening economic conditions, rising unemployment, and hunger in the Covid-wracked country.

item.title: 5 things about Melania Trump revealed in Stephanie Grisham's new book
item.description: During her five years working in various roles as a senior aide to Donald and Melania Trump, Stephanie Grisham had perhaps the most intimate vantage point of their time in the White House.

item.title: Jim Acosta to Fox News host: Viewers may soon not be around to listen to your lies
item.description: CNN's Jim Acosta explains the consequences of Fox News host Tucker Carlson and far-right personalities spreading coronavirus misinformation.

item.title: Donald Trump ratchets up demands on Gov. Greg Abbott to review Texas election results
item.description: Former President Donald Trump is ramping up pressure on Texas Gov. Greg Abbott to allow an election review bill to move forward in a state he won in 2020 -- as Trump continues his election fraud crusade nearly a year after losing the White House.

item.title: A look at the women who brought R. Kelly to justice
item.description: Behind the downfall of R. Kelly stand dozens of women who helped bring attention to his crimes and those who helped prosecute him.

item.title: Must-watch videos of the week
Big Oil is going all-out to fight climate rules in Build Back Better
item.description: America's oil-and-gas industry is fighting tooth and nail to kill or scale back climate provisions in the President Joe Biden's $3.5 trillion Build Back Better plan.

item.title: Kyrsten Sinema's politics may be unnecessarily moderate
item.description: Democratic hopes for passing big legislation through the Senate rely on Joe Manchin of West Virginia and Kyrsten Sinema of Arizona. Both have made things difficult for Senate Democrats because they are moderates who have been hesitant to pass big spending packages.

item.title: New Zealand says foreign nationals must have coronavirus vaccination to enter country
item.description: All foreign nationals entering New Zealand will need to be fully vaccinated from November 1, the government announced Sunday.

item.title: A major oil spill off the California coast has caused dead birds, fish and oil to wash up on Huntington Beach, officials say
item.description: A spill of about 3,000 barrels of oil -- or roughly 126,000 gallons of post-production crude -- off the coast of Southern California is a "potential ecological disaster," Huntington Beach Mayor Kim Carr said Saturday.

item.title: Britney Spears says she still has 'a lot of healing to do'
item.description: Days after her father was suspended as conservator of her estate, Britney Spears said she's taking some time for self-care.

item.title: French military aircraft banned from Algerian airspace amid diplomatic row
item.description: The French military says its planes have been banned from Algerian airspace amid a diplomatic spat between the two countries.

item.title: Trump-fueled falsehoods have deep roots
item.description: In January 1980, Mary McCarthy appeared on Dick Cavett's talk show to promote her latest novel. When the conversation drifted to "overpraised" writers, McCarthy trained her fire on playwright Lillian Hellman, whom she had disliked for at least three decades.

item.title: Should you get a Covid-19 booster now? An expert weighs in
item.description: To get a booster or not? The US Food and Drug Administration and US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention have issued guidance that some adults can receive a third shot of the Pfizer/BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine, so it's time to ask that question.

item.title: Repairing the planet can begin with our personal devices
item.description: The life cycle of a smartphone begins in mines around the world. There, raw materials and rare earth metals are extracted from the planet in an energy-intensive process.

item.title: Woman shot by school safety officer to be disconnected from life support, family says
item.description: An 18-year-old woman shot by a school safety officer after an altercation near a Long Beach, California, high school is expected to be disconnected from life support this weekend, her family said at a news conference Friday.

item.title: 'SNL' returns with a new Joe Biden, looking to unite Democrats
item.description: "Saturday Night Live" is back, and with it came a new President Joe Biden.

item.title: Supreme Court justices take on critics in rare public remarks
item.description: Five of the nine Supreme Court justices made a notable series of rare public opinions, striking a provocative tone while off the bench. CNN's Jessica Schneider reports new polling shows the lowest approval rating for the Supreme Court in decades.

item.title: More than 230 people arrested in Nebraska anti-gang operation dubbed 'K.O.'
item.description: A multi-agency law enforcement operation in Nebraska resulted in the arrest of 231 people, according to the US Marshals Service.

item.title: 10-year-old dies of Covid-19 just days after contracting virus
item.description: Nicole and Jeff Sperry are mourning their 10-year-old daughter who died just days after contracting Covid-19. They remember their daughter's life and remind others that the virus should still be taken seriously.

item.title: Video of Fox News' studio paints a different picture than what hosts say on TV
item.description: A video of the new Fox News studio in DC captured top talent and leaders at the network all wearing masks. CNN's Brian Stelter says this is telling because many of the network's top hosts rail against mask-wearing.

item.title: Oregon man charged in fatal shooting of man who spoke to his girlfriend
item.description: An Oregon man has been arrested and indicted on charges stemming from the fatal shooting of a man that prosecutors say occurred after the victim spoke to the suspect's girlfriend.

item.title: How America ruined Christmas
item.description: The supply chain nightmare that's been plaguing the global economy for over a year is about to snarl the holiday shopping season. Think barren shelves, massive shipping delays, and no small amount of sticker shock. Merry Christmas, everyone!

item.title: Man dies after falling while subway surfing
item.description: A man in New York City died early Saturday morning while subway surfing on top of the J-train on the Williamsburg Bridge.

item.title: Stelter: This is the real reason Trump wants back on Twitter
item.description: CNN's Brian Stelter says that former President Donald Trump is suing to get back onto Twitter because Trump clearly believes he needs Twitter in order to run for President in 2024.

item.title: 'I am both tickled and horrified': Reporter reacts to UK game show
item.description: This week on "Pop Off," CNN reporter Lisa Respers France talks about Hollywood's obsession with true crime stories. Subscribe to Lisa's "Pop Life Chronicles" newsletter here.

item.title: 'Venom: Let There Be Carnage' becomes biggest opening of the pandemic
item.description: Venom devoured the box office.

item.title: Winning numbers announced for Saturday's $635 million Powerball jackpot
item.description: The winning numbers for a Powerball jackpot estimated at $635 million were drawn on Saturday.

item.title: He's the most popular man on TikTok. And he doesn't say a word
item.description: When Italy first went into a coronavirus lockdown last year, Khabane Lame had just lost his job at a factory near the northern city of Turin.

item.title: This 'Big Brother' winner just made history
item.description: After 21 years on TV, CBS' "Big Brother" crowned its first Black winner.

item.title: Lionel Messi suffers first defeat as a PSG player as Rennes stages surprise
item.description: Paris Saint-Germain slumped to a shock 2-0 defeat against Rennes Sunday, bringing its perfect start to the new Ligue 1 season to an end.

item.title: Adele fans think the artist may have a new album on the way
item.description: Adele fans think the singer has a new album coming. And they may be right.

item.title: The tradition traces back to the 1700s. These women are fighting to keep it alive through online retail.
item.description: Many African cultures in the United States have been fighting to keep their traditions and unique way of life alive, and now, an online retail outlet is helping the Gullah community in Charleston, South Carolina, use tech to reach a wider audience.

item.title: South Africa's skateboarders are kick-flipping to the next level
item.description: From the streets of South African cities to the world stage of the Olympic Games, skateboarding continues to grow across the African continent. Meet the Olympians, local skate legends, and equipment design gurus elevating their sport to new heights.

item.title: Mars robots take cruise control during solar event
item.description: Everyone needs a break.

item.title: Sing a song of freedom with 'Diana: The Musical' and more
item.description: With Britney Spears' conservatorship battle back in the news this week, it seems appropriate to reflect on the dark side of celebrity.

item.title: A body believed to be Miya Marcano has been found
item.description: Authorities have found a body believed to be 19-year-old Miya Marcano, the Orange County, Florida, sheriff said in a news conference Saturday, just over a week after she was last seen.

item.title: California desert search for women missing from Airbnb
item.description: New Jersey native Lauren Cho has been missing since late June while she was staying at an Airbnb in southern California outside of Los Angeles. CNN's Natasha Chen reports.

item.title: How a simple hand gesture has kicked off an online firestorm in South Korea
item.description: • South Korea's young men are fighting against feminism

item.title: What we learned in Elizabeth Holmes trial
item.description: The trial of Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes concluded its fourth week on Friday, with the lengthiest witness testimony of the trial so far.

item.title: 'World's best airline' for 2021 revealed
item.description: It hasn't been a great year for airlines, thanks to Covid's impact on the aviation industry, but for one Middle East carrier it's just got a lot better.

item.title: Kenya's Joyciline Jepkosgei races to victory in women's London Marathon
item.description: Kenya's Joyciline Jepkosgei stormed to victory in the elite women's race at this year's London Marathon on Sunday, crossing the line in an impressive two hours, 17 minutes and 43 seconds.

item.title: United Nations body broadly tipped as the frontrunner to take this year's Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: After 18 turbulent months spent tackling the global Covid-19 pandemic, the World Health Organization (WHO) is being broadly tipped as the frontrunner to take this year's Nobel Peace Prize.
